Description: Terracotta head from a large figure, probably male. Possibly a worshipper wearing helmet or headdress, in Neo-Cypriot style. Hollow and mould-made with hand-made plastic elements added. Eye-sockets defined by ridges and almond-shaped eye. Crude and flat back. No trace of paint left on the figure. Red-brown to salmon-orange marl clay with lighter surface; fine white, red and dark grey inclusions.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
'A' written on back in pencil. Cypro-Archaic terracotta figure with parallels in the British Museum (GR 1864,1007.1331). Marked in pencil with an 'A'.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DA.006) (Phase 3)
